entities.description: The number assigned to each offender in the survey.
A category indicating that the number of offenders is unknown.
The unweighted frequency of responses for each offender number.
The percentage of total cases represented by each frequency.
Data that is missing or not reported in the survey responses.
Statistical measures related to the survey data.
The total number of valid and total survey cases.
The methods used in the survey such as mean, median, mode, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation.

relationships.description: Identifies the offender number in the survey data.
Relates each offender number to its corresponding frequency in the survey.
Indicates the percentage of total cases represented by each frequency.
Identifies data that is missing or not reported in the survey.
Encompasses statistical measures related to the survey data.
Indicates the number of valid and total survey cases.
Defines the methods used to calculate survey statistics such as mean, median, mode, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation.
